Docker está instalado y corriendo correctamente. También puedes usar:

- `systemctl status docker` - Ver estado del servicio
- `docker ps` - Listar contenedores corriendo
- `docker images` - Ver imágenes disponibles

FROM nginxinc/nginx-unprivileged:1.23.4-alpine-slim

ARG NGINX_ENV="default"
ARG COMMIT_SHA
ENV REACT_APP_COMMIT_SHA=$COMMIT_SHA

COPY ./build /app

USER 0
RUN touch /app/env.js && chown nginx:nginx /app/env.js /app/index.html && chmod g+rw /app/env.js \
    && sed '/worker_processes/s/auto/2/' -i /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
COPY scripts/entrypoint.sh /docker-entrypoint.d/entrypoint.sh
USER 101

COPY config/${NGINX_ENV}.conf /etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf

content.text:
El docker de esta aplicación se llama **`huib`** y puedes construirlo con:

```bash
npm run build:container
```

Para ejecutarlo:
```bash
npm run preview:container
```

La imagen se crea como `huib:latest` según el `package.json:11`.

content.text:
Tienes dos imágenes con el mismo IMAGE ID (`d6872804e0a2`), lo que significa que son la misma imagen pero con diferentes nombres/tags:

- `huib-ui:latest` 
- `huib:latest`

Esto puede ocurrir por:
1. **Tags múltiples**: Se etiquetó la misma imagen con dos nombres diferentes

file.content:
---
version: '3.9'

secrets:
  HUI_SSL_CERT:
    external: true
  HUI_SSL_KEY:
    external: true

services:
  hui:
    image: hui:363
    environment:
      REACT_APP_GATEKEEPER_URL: https://gatekeeper.example.net/gatekeeper
      REACT_APP_KEYSTORE_URL: https://keystore.example.net/keystore
      REACT_APP_PREFERENCES_SERVER_URL: https://preference.example.net/preference
      REACT_APP_KEYCLOAK_URL: keycloak.example.net
      REACT_APP_SCRUBBER_URL: https://scrubber.example.net/api/v1/hansken
      REACT_APP_MAP_TILES_STANDARD: https://osm.example.net/maps/tiles/osm-bright/{z}/{x}/{y}.png
    secrets:
      - source: HUI_SSL_CERT
        target: cert
      - source: HUI_SSL_KEY
        target: key
    ports:
      - mode: host
        protocol: tcp
        published: 80
        target: 80
      - mode: host
        protocol: tcp
        published: 443
        target: 443

file.content:
image: node:22-alpine

stages:
  - install
  - test
  - build
  - release

workflow:
  rules:
    - if: $CI_PIPELINE_SOURCE == "merge_request_event"
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_TAG
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_REF_PROTECTED == "true"
      when: always

install:
  stage: install
  artifacts:
    untracked: true
  script: npm ci
  interruptible: true

lint:
  stage: test
  rules:
    - when: always
  needs:
    - install
  variables:
    GIT_DEPTH: 200
  image: timbru31/node-alpine-git:22
  script: npm run lint-changed:check
  interruptible: true

typescript:
  stage: test
  needs:
    - install
  script: npm run tsc:ci
  interruptible: true

vitest:
  stage: test
  needs:
    - install
  script:
    - npm run test:ci
  interruptible: true

build application:
  stage: build
  needs:
    - install
  rules:
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_DRAFT
      when: never
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "develop"'
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "develop"'
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "main"'
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main"'
      when: always
  script:
    # Ignore warnings on building npm package
    - CI=false
    - npm run build:dev
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - build
  interruptible: true

test container:
  stage: build
  needs:
    - typescript
    - vitest
    - build application
  rules:
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_DRAFT
      when: never
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "develop"'
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "main"'
  image: docker
  script:
    - TAG="develop-${CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA}-$(date +%s)"
    - docker build --build-arg  http_proxy="${http_proxy}" --build-arg https_proxy="${https_proxy}" -t "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${TAG}" .
  interruptible: true


test release:
  stage: release
  rules:
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_DRAFT
      when: never
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_APPROVED && $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "develop"
      when: manual
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "main"
      when: manual
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "develop"'
      when: always
  needs:
    - typescript
    - vitest
    - build application
  image: docker
  script:
    - TAG="develop-${CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA}-$(date +%s)"
    - docker login -u "${CI_REGISTRY_USER}" -p "${CI_JOB_TOKEN}" "${CI_REGISTRY}"
    - docker build --build-arg COMMIT_SHA="${TAG}" --build-arg http_proxy="${http_proxy}" --build-arg https_proxy="${https_proxy}" -t "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${TAG}" .
    - docker push "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${TAG}"
  interruptible: true

registry check:
  stage: release
  rules:
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main" && $CI_COMMIT_TAG'
      when: always
  image:
    name: gcr.io/go-containerregistry/crane:debug
    entrypoint: [""]
  script:
    - BUILD_VERSION="$(cat package.json | sed -rn 's/"build". ([0-9]+),/\1/p' | xargs)"
    - crane auth login -u $CI_REGISTRY_USER -p $CI_JOB_TOKEN $CI_REGISTRY
    - if crane manifest $CI_REGISTRY/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${BUILD_VERSION}; then echo "container already exists" && exit 1; else echo "container does not exist"; fi
  interruptible: true

acceptance release:
  stage: release
  rules:
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main"'
      when: manual
  needs:
    - typescript
    - vitest
    - build application
    - registry check
  image: docker
  script:
    - BUILD_VERSION="$(cat package.json | sed -rn 's/"build". ([0-9]+),/\1/p' | xargs)"
    - docker build --build-arg http_proxy="${http_proxy}" --build-arg https_proxy="${https_proxy}" -t "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${BUILD_VERSION}" .
    - docker login -u "${CI_REGISTRY_USER}" -p "${CI_JOB_TOKEN}" "${CI_REGISTRY}"
    - docker push "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${BUILD_VERSION}"
  interruptible: true

content.text:
Hay dos imágenes porque:

1. **GitLab CI** (líneas 85, 108, 139) crea imágenes como `huib-ui:${TAG}` 
2. **npm script** (`package.json:11`) crea imagen como `huib:latest`

El pipeline de GitLab usa el nombre `huib-ui` para el registro oficial, mientras que el script local usa `huib` para desarrollo. Probablemente alguien etiquetó la misma imagen con ambos nombres manualmente con:

```bash
docker tag huib-ui:latest huib:latest
```

Son la misma imagen (mismo IMAGE ID), solo nombres diferentes para diferentes propósitos.
Puedes eliminar uno de los tags duplicados:

{
    "name": "hui-ufd",
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "build": 410,
    "private": true,
    "scripts": {
        "start": "vite",
        "start:prod": "NODE_ENV=production vite",
        "build": "vite build",
        "build:dev": "vite build --mode development",
        "build:container": "docker build --build-arg NGINX_ENV=development --tag huib:latest .",
        "preview": "vite preview --host",
        "preview:container": "docker run --rm -it --env-file .env -p 9000:80 huib:latest",
        "test": "vitest watch",
        "test:no-watch": "vitest run -u",
        "test:ci": "TZ=CET CI=true vitest run --environment=jsdom --silent --coverage",
        "test:coverage": "vitest run --coverage",
        "prettier:fix": "prettier ./src/**/*.{jsx,ts,tsx,css} --write --config prettier.config.js",
        "prettier:check": "prettier ./src/**/*.{jsx,ts,tsx,css} --check --config prettier.config.js",
        "lint": "eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx",
        "lint:errors": "eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx --quiet",
        "lint:fix": "eslint --fix --cache ./src/**/*.{jsx,ts,tsx}",
        "lint-changed:fix": "./scripts/lint-changed.sh fix",
        "lint-changed:check": "./scripts/lint-changed.sh check",
        "tsc": "npx tsc  --project tsconfig.ci.json",
        "tsc:ci": "npx tsc --noEmit --project tsconfig.ci.json",
        "tsc:local": "npx tsc --noEmit --project tsconfig.json",
        "tsc:gen": "npx openapi-typescript",
        "createReleaseNote": "node scripts/createReleaseNote.mjs",
        "mergeReleaseNotes": "node scripts/mergeReleaseNotes.mjs",
        "removeReleaseNoteFiles": "node scripts/removeReleaseNoteFiles.mjs",
        "cypress:run": "cypress run --browser firefox",
        "cypress:run-ci": "cypress run --browser firefox --env HANSKEN_USERNAME=${HANSKEN_USERNAME},HANSKEN_PASSWORD=${HANSKEN_PASSWORD}",

toolUseResult.originalFile:
image: node:22-alpine

stages:
  - install
  - test
  - build
  - release

workflow:
  rules:
    - if: $CI_PIPELINE_SOURCE == "merge_request_event"
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_TAG
    - if: $CI_COMMIT_REF_PROTECTED == "true"
      when: always

install:
  stage: install
  artifacts:
    untracked: true
  script: npm ci
  interruptible: true

lint:
  stage: test
  rules:
    - when: always
  needs:
    - install
  variables:
    GIT_DEPTH: 200
  image: timbru31/node-alpine-git:22
  script: npm run lint-changed:check
  interruptible: true

typescript:
  stage: test
  needs:
    - install
  script: npm run tsc:ci
  interruptible: true

vitest:
  stage: test
  needs:
    - install
  script:
    - npm run test:ci
  interruptible: true

build application:
  stage: build
  needs:
    - install
  rules:
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_DRAFT
      when: never
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "develop"'
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "develop"'
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "main"'
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main"'
      when: always
  script:
    # Ignore warnings on building npm package
    - CI=false
    - npm run build:dev
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - build
  interruptible: true

test container:
  stage: build
  needs:
    - typescript
    - vitest
    - build application
  rules:
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_DRAFT
      when: never
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "develop"'
    - if: '$CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "main"'
  image: docker
  script:
    - TAG="develop-${CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA}-$(date +%s)"
    - docker build --build-arg  http_proxy="${http_proxy}" --build-arg https_proxy="${https_proxy}" -t "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${TAG}" .
  interruptible: true


test release:
  stage: release
  rules:
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_DRAFT
      when: never
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_APPROVED && $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "develop"
      when: manual
    - if: $CI_MERGE_REQUEST_TARGET_BRANCH_NAME == "main"
      when: manual
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "develop"'
      when: always
  needs:
    - typescript
    - vitest
    - build application
  image: docker
  script:
    - TAG="develop-${CI_COMMIT_SHORT_SHA}-$(date +%s)"
    - docker login -u "${CI_REGISTRY_USER}" -p "${CI_JOB_TOKEN}" "${CI_REGISTRY}"
    - docker build --build-arg COMMIT_SHA="${TAG}" --build-arg http_proxy="${http_proxy}" --build-arg https_proxy="${https_proxy}" -t "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${TAG}" .
    - docker push "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${TAG}"
  interruptible: true

registry check:
  stage: release
  rules:
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main" && $CI_COMMIT_TAG'
      when: always
  image:
    name: gcr.io/go-containerregistry/crane:debug
    entrypoint: [""]
  script:
    - BUILD_VERSION="$(cat package.json | sed -rn 's/"build". ([0-9]+),/\1/p' | xargs)"
    - crane auth login -u $CI_REGISTRY_USER -p $CI_JOB_TOKEN $CI_REGISTRY
    - if crane manifest $CI_REGISTRY/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${BUILD_VERSION}; then echo "container already exists" && exit 1; else echo "container does not exist"; fi
  interruptible: true

acceptance release:
  stage: release
  rules:
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == "main"'
      when: manual
  needs:
    - typescript
    - vitest
    - build application
    - registry check
  image: docker
  script:
    - BUILD_VERSION="$(cat package.json | sed -rn 's/"build". ([0-9]+),/\1/p' | xargs)"
    - docker build --build-arg http_proxy="${http_proxy}" --build-arg https_proxy="${https_proxy}" -t "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${BUILD_VERSION}" .
    - docker login -u "${CI_REGISTRY_USER}" -p "${CI_JOB_TOKEN}" "${CI_REGISTRY}"
    - docker push "${CI_REGISTRY}/hansken/huib/huib-ui:${BUILD_VERSION}"
  interruptible: true

edits.new_string: - if crane manifest $CI_REGISTRY/hansken/huib/huib-ui-ufd:${BUILD_VERSION}; then echo "container already exists" && exit 1; else echo "container does not exist"; fi

toolUseResult.originalFile:
---
version: '3.9'

secrets:
  HUI_SSL_CERT:
    external: true
  HUI_SSL_KEY:
    external: true

services:
  hui:
    image: hui:363
    environment:
      REACT_APP_GATEKEEPER_URL: https://gatekeeper.example.net/gatekeeper
      REACT_APP_KEYSTORE_URL: https://keystore.example.net/keystore
      REACT_APP_PREFERENCES_SERVER_URL: https://preference.example.net/preference
      REACT_APP_KEYCLOAK_URL: keycloak.example.net
      REACT_APP_SCRUBBER_URL: https://scrubber.example.net/api/v1/hansken
      REACT_APP_MAP_TILES_STANDARD: https://osm.example.net/maps/tiles/osm-bright/{z}/{x}/{y}.png
    secrets:
      - source: HUI_SSL_CERT
        target: cert
      - source: HUI_SSL_KEY
        target: key
    ports:
      - mode: host
        protocol: tcp
        published: 80
        target: 80
      - mode: host
        protocol: tcp
        published: 443
        target: 443

content.text:
Ahora puedes ejecutar el contenedor con las variables de `huib.env`:

```bash
npm run preview:container
```

O directamente:
```bash
docker run --rm -it --env-file huib.env -p 9000:80 huib-ui-ufd:latest
```

El contenedor usará las URLs de UFD configuradas en `huib.env`.

content.text:
Para el desarrollo local, la aplicación inicia en:

**Puerto 3000**: `http://localhost:3000` (comando `npm start`)

Para el contenedor Docker:

**Puerto 9000**: `http://localhost:9000` (comando `npm run preview:container`)

Si quieres verificar qué puertos están configurados:

message.content: voy a cerrar el entorno de desarrollo y reiniciar el ordenador. Dime los pasos para lanzar el docker cuando reinicie

content.text:
Para lanzar el Docker cuando reinicies:

1. **Verificar que Docker esté corriendo:**
   ```bash
   docker info
   ```

2. **Navegar al directorio del proyecto:**
   ```bash
   cd /home/rj/dev/huib-ui-ufd
   ```

3. **Ejecutar el contenedor:**
   ```bash
   npm run preview:container
   ```

**O directamente con Docker:**
```bash
docker run --rm -it --env-file huib.env -p 9000:80 huib-ui-ufd:latest
```

4. **Acceder a la aplicación:**
   - URL: `http://localhost:9000`

**Si la imagen no existe**, primero construirla:
```bash
npm run build:container
```

La aplicación usará las variables de entorno configuradas en `huib.env`.
